text: FADE IN SECOND CARD -- The Crime Rate in the United State Hundred Percent.
In 1988, the crime rate in the United States rises four h GRAPHIC -- Line-graphic of New York, MANHATTAN ISLAND hig
The once-great city of New York becomes the one maximum-s for the entire country. GRAPHIC -- MANHATTAN ISLAND lights up.  The word "Prison"

A fifty-foot containment wall is erected along the New Je across the Harlem river, and down along the Brooklyn shor completely surrounds Manhattan Island. GRAPHIC -- The containment wall is added to the line grap tag "Containment Wall".
All bridges and waterways are mined. GRAPHIC -- Dots symbolizing the bridges and waterways bli
The United States Police Force, like an army, is encamped island. GRAPHIC -- Arrows symbolizing the police force are added. of Liberty Island Security Control.
There are no guards inside the prison: only prisoners and they have made. NEW GRAPHIC -- Outline drawing of New York.
The rules are simple.  Once you go in, you don't come out GRAPHIC -- Outline drawing of the Statue of Liberty and t are added.
A Jeep pulls up outside the base.  It comes to a stop and pulls out a walkie-talkie.
This is Gotham 4, North Bay, Station 17.  I have an escap An object in mid-bay moving toward the wall.
EXT. CLOSE UP -- SIGN "New York Maximum Security Penitent Island"
Two guards watch for the escapees in question.
A helicopter flies over the bay towards Manhattan Island.
The two escapees paddle, trying to get across the bay.
The search light WHITES OUT THE SCREEN
The two escapees continue paddling.  THEY'VE BEEN CAUGHT.
You have 10 seconds.  Turn around.  Start back to the isl
The pilot targets the boat on a computer screen in front
Two shots are fired directly in front of the escapees as They ignore them and continue paddling away from the isla
The pilot FIRES AGAIN.
The boat EXPLODES.
Following the helicopter as it returns to the base.
Rehme walks back to the main base, pulling out his walkie way.
Gotham 4, confirm the kill.
Circled the base.  Over.
Security, this is Rehme.  We have confirmation from Gotha kill in midharbor.  South of the battery.  Two in the wat
Two confirmed.
Very well.
Rehme walks into a building labeled "LIBERTY ISLAND SECUR picks up a phone.
Air traffic, this is Rehme . . .
The helicopter lands.  In the background, a BUS FULL OF P up.

S.D. "SNAKE" PLISSKEN gets off the bus, looks around, and three guards into the base.  He looks like the essence of hair is long, wavy, and ratty, he lost his left eye somew line, and he's got a two-day beard thing going on.  He's spandex/kevlar type shirt with zippers across the shoulde of camouflage pants with lots of pockets.  His jacket is jacket that has seen far better days, and he's wearing a handcuffs that have, instead of the links we're used to, metal bar between them.  He's not resisting anything, but not taking any chances.
Plissken and the guards follow a winding stairway down to floor.

Attention.  You are now entering the debarkation area.  N smoking.   The next scheduled departure to the prison is You now have the option to terminate and be cremated on t If you elect this option, notify the duty sergeant in you area.

EXT. CLOSE UP ON SIGN -- "No talking.  No smoking.  Follo line." EXT. CLOSE UP ON SNAKE.  He is not impressed. STEADICAM VIEW OF THE HALL, SNAKE'S P.O.V. Guards, guards Who cares. As Snake rounds the corner:
Hold it. Snake stops, turns, directs an impertinent glance at the still not impressed by any of this. FADE OUT.
Rehme waits as a limo pulls up.  Out steps BOB HAUK.
We've got a small jet in trouble, over restricted air spa
Where is it?
Seven miles out and closing. The two of them walk AWAY.
Hauk and Rehme walk down the stairs.  They turn TOWARD US the AIR TRAFFIC ROOM.  Dozens of men sit in front of rada screens, wearing headsets and working.   Following Hauk a the room:

We've been on the board for the last twenty minutes.  We able to reach them.  There was a transmission ten minutes identified as "David 14."  Then all of a sudden he was cu Hauk and Rehme stand behind a CONTROLLER.
David 14, acknowledge.  David 14, we are sending Air Resc 7700, contact on 121.5. (to Hauk and Rehme) There's still no reply. (to his headset) Bayonne.  I have a mayday in restricted space.
New York, I have it. Hauk pulls Rehme aside.
Who is it?
I don't know.
You have the code?
There's no David 14 on the computer.
Unlisted?
Unregistered code.  We telexed Washington.  Still waiting
I think I've got him, sir. Hauk and Rehme walk back over to the controller.  He patc over through.
It's too late, assholes.  All your imperialist weapons an save him now.  We're going down.  We're going to crash.
David 14, acknowledge!
The code's coming in, sir. Hauk and Rehme dash over to the codeman.  He shows them a "Aircraft Identified.  Code: David14.  Decode: AIR FORCE "Air Force One" blinks as Hauk and Rehme look at each oth
The plane is flying over New York.
The REBEL has killed the pilot and copilot and is working
Tell this to the workers when they ask where your leader She pulls out a slip of PAPER and proceeds to read.
We, the soldiers of the national liberation front of Amer name of the workers and all the oppressed of this imperia have struck a fatal blow to the racist police stick!
A secret service AGENT taps on the door with his rifle as continues.
What better revolutionary example than to let the preside the inhuman dungeon of his own imperialist prison? The agent runs back down the plane to the President and h
(to 2ND AGENT) Unlock the pod! 2ND AGENT immediately runs off. PAN LEFT TO PRESIDENT.
She's bolted the door.
Can't you shoot off the lock?
No, sir, she's pressurized the cabin.
How about lifting the door off of the hinges?
No, sir. EXT. CLOSE UP -- The President's wrist as he handcuffs hi it.
Get me to the pod. The President and all his advisors stand up and move to t plane.
The pod opens.  An expert attaches a locating device to t wrist.
Sir, this is a locating device to trace you if you become the pod.  I'm activating it now. SCREENS on the pod begin to light up as the President get He pushes a few buttons.
God save me and watch over you all.
A guard watches as Air Force One descends into New York.
Rehme and Hauk watch a computer simulation of the plane.
Computer simulation tracking Air Force One.
The plane goes down.
As the plane smashes into a building, a red dot drops thr building.  It's the pod.
It's down!
It's the escape pod.
40 degrees, 50 yards from impact.
I'm going in.
Helicopters prepare for, and execute, launch, and fly int guard watches them.
Rehme watches monitors as Hauk talks.
1-W-Larry.  Over the battery.  We're moving down.  Direct

The helicopters land.  A swarm of policemen run out, and back.  He follows with a second swarm.  The first swarm a defensive position near the pod.  Hauk examines the pod. definitely empty, and the rest of the jet is surrounded i An odd LAUGH from nowhere. WEIRDO walks out of the darkness.  He nods his head to Ha

You touch me... he dies.  If you're not in the air in thi he dies.  You come back in... he dies. Weirdo takes a package out of his shirt and unwraps it to President's middle finger, complete with ring.
Twenty seconds.
I'm ready to talk.
Nineteen.  Eighteen.
What do you want?
Seventeen.  Sixteen.
Let's go.  Let's go! Weirdo grins in triumph as the police force swarms back t helicopters and hauls ass out of New York.
Rehme stands behind a desk, talking on the phone.  Hauk i foreground, looking pensive.
Yes, he's right here, Mr. Vice President. Hauk picks up a phone.
This is Bob Hauk.  ...We can't.  If we move in with chopp kill him.  We're lucky if he's not dead already... They d anything yet.  By the time they figure out what they want late.
Tell him we have to go with your plan now. Hauk waves him off.
We can't wait until tomorrow.  If we have to move in and island, it's a last resort.  It's 8:45.  I want permissio rescue.  Thank you.
Hauk calmly arms a .45 pistol.  He looks up from his desk
All right.
He's dangerous, sir.

(with quiet confidence) I know.  I'll be OK. HAUK'S P.O.V. We see the silhouette of an unmistakable figure.  It's Sn all right, live and in the flesh.  The guards leave.  Sna Hauk's office and sits down in the chair across from Hauk his cuffed hands to Hauk as if to say "Take these off me, he doesn't actually say anything.  Hauk shakes his head.
I'm not a fool, Plissken.
(coooooool) Call me Snake. Hauk puts on his glasses and proceeds to read a file.

S.D. Plissken.  American Lieutenant.  Special Forces Unit Two Purple Hearts, Leningrad and Siberia.  Youngest man t by the President.  You robbed the federal reserve deposit sentence, New York Maximum Security Penitentiary. I'm rea ass out of the world, War Hero. Snake could not care less.  He reaches forward with his s right hand, picks up a cigarette, picks up a match with h strikes the match and takes a drag from his cigarette.  H calm breath and says:
Who are you?
Hauk.  Police Commissioner.
Bob Hauk...
Special Forces Unit.  Texas Thunder.  We heard of you, to
Why are we talking?

I have a deal for you.  You'll receive full pardon for ev act committed in the United States. Hauk shows Snake the pardon.  Snake's eye lights up.  Thi he wants.  He's interested now, and can't hide it.
(pressing his advantage) There was an accident about an hour ago.  A small jet wen New York City.  The President was on board.
(re-establishing control over the conversation) President of what?

That's not funny, Plissken.  (beat)  You go in, find the bring him out in 24 hours, and you're a free man. We sense amusement from Snake.  This is not the first tim government has asked him for a favor.  But he's not a sol Hero" anymore.  He knows they need him more than he needs He's holding the cards now, and he knows it.
Twenty-four hours, huh?
I'm making you an offer.
Bullshit.
Straight just like I said.
I'll think about it.
No time.  Give me an answer. Snake turns away.  Hauk is pushing way too hard, and Snak to be in the driver's seat.
Get a new president.
We're still at war, Plissken.  We need him alive.
I don't give a fuck about your war... or your president.
Is that your answer?
I'm thinking about it.
Think hard. Snake pauses to take a draw on his cigarette.  Next quest
Why me?
You flew the Gullfire over Leningrad.  You know how to ge You're all I've got.
I guess I go in one way or the other.  Doesn't mean shit the paper.
When you come out.
Before.
I told you I wasn't a fool, Plissken.
Call me Snake.
Rehme talks as we PAN ACROSS a table full of weapons.  We a belt, grenades, several pouches full of various stuff, Uzi, throwing stars, and more.  Snake surveys them with a expression.

Some of them have cars.  They took old junkers that were converted them to steam.  We think they may also have a g in there, and power.  Greenhouses, rigged up generators. have streetlights. The crazies.  Live in the subways.  Co of the underground.  They're night raiders. Snake's not into this.  He'll figure it out when he gets picks up a bracelet with an eagle on it.

Tracer.  Sends a radio signal for fifteen minutes.  You p track you on radar.  Just like Leningrad.  But they added safety catch. Snake pushes the safety catch.  Simple enough.  And yes, button.  This is familiar.  He smiles.
Snake has his jacket slung over his shoulder now.  He wal hall to the medical room with Hauk.  Rehme has disappeare
Where am I landing?

Top of the world trade center.  Only place you can land. it, and you can take off from a free fall.  On the roof t service elevator.  It's still operational.  We use it to prison.  There's a power box.  It'll activate the elevato fifty.  From there on down you walk. Snake shrugs on his jacket.  He knows Hauk is just trying authority, and it's not working very well.
You can locate the President by his vital signs bracelet, It sends out a sig pulse.  Use this. He hands Snake a homing device.
Homing device.  Shows directions and distance.
Snake and Hauk walk into the room.  They're met by a youn
Strong antitoxin.  Stops bacteria and viral-proofs you fo Snake braces himself against a table.  The medic is holdi injection-type tech gizmo.
Take off the jacket.
I'll be OK.
Let's go, Plissken. Snake shrugs off his jacket, disoriented by the place.  H His hackles are up.
I don't like needles. Hauk straps a timer gauge onto Snake's left hand.  He act the time blinks on.  It's counting down as we speak.
Twenty-two hours, twenty-nine minutes, fifty-seven second
We talked about twenty-four.
In twenty-two hours the Hartford Summit meeting will be o the Soviet Union will go back home.  The president was on summit when his plane went down. Snake snorts.
He has a briefcase attached to his wrist.  The tape recor to reach Hartford in 22 hours.
What's on it?
You know anything about nuclear fusion? Snake turns away.  No.  Nuclear fusion is not his area of
It's about the survival of the human race, Plissken.  Som don't give a shit about. Hauk steps aside.  The medic swabs Snake's neck on both s
I'm going to inject you.  It'll sting for a second or two He raises a couple of hypos and injects Snake with them. little; clearly, this is not one of the world's most plea
That's it, Plissken. Snake gets off the table.  The medic turns around.
Tell him.
Tell me what? Hauk thinks he's got him this time.  Snake doesn't like t
That idea you had about turning the Gullfire around 180 d flying off to Canada. Hauk shakes his head.  Snake puts his jacket down and tur medic.
What did you do to me, asshole?

My idea, Plissken.  Something we've been fooling around w microscopic capsules lodged in your arteries.  They're al to dissolve.  In twenty-two hours, the cores will complet Inside the cores are that heat-sensitive charge.  Not a l About the size of a pinhead.  Just big enough to -- (he gestures) open up both your arteries.  I'd say you'd be dead in ten seconds -- Hauk stops talking because Snake has grabbed him by the t
They're protected by the cores.  Fifteen minutes before t up we can neutralize the charge with X-rays. Snake lets go of Hauk to look at his watch.  22:57:38.  3 is his life he's watching tick away.
We'll burn out the charges IF you have the President.
What if I'm a little late?
No more Hartford Summit.  And no more Snake Plissken.
When I get back I'm going to kill you.
The Gullfire's waiting.
Snake pulls up in a Jeep.  He walks up to the tiny plane Gullfire.  Two guards stand by to make sure he just gets and does his job.  He throws his cigarette out onto the r closes the overhead window.
Snake turns on his monitors.
I'm ready.
21 hours.
Suppose he's dead, Hauk.  If I come back without him, you things out?
Hauk and Rehme exchange a glance; Hauk's been expecting t come up.
Get them both back, Plissken.
Snake doesn't like the response, but figures he can't do it.
Remember, once inside you're on your own.
Oh, you mean I can't count on you?
No.
Good.
A larger plane hauls the Gullfire into the air; the Gullf essentially a big hang glider.
Hauk checks Snake's life clock, "Master Life Clock". 20:17:43... 42... 41....
Snake's watch reads 20:17:40... 39... 38... 37... 36... 3 He starts controlling the plane.  He flips the tracer ope button, testing it.
The master life clock shows the test confirmation.
Tracer test confirmed at 20 hours, 17 minutes, 30 seconds Hauk, Rehme and the Vice President nod with relief.
Snake takes the plane in.
Snake looks over his monitors.  He sees New York coming u
Hauk waits at his microphone.
Are you picking up the target blip?
Right on course.
The plane aims for the World Trade Center.
It's been a while . . . The plane is aiming right at a building.
How's your altitude? Snake calmly angles the plane up.
Plissken?  Plissken?  Plissken, what are you doing?
Playing with myself.  I'm going in. Snake targets the World Trade Center.  He checks his inst
The plane comes down.  It hits hard.  Snake puts on the b grappling hook, and finally comes to a stop right at the
Plissken?  Plissken?
Snake walks over to the elevator.  He uses the power box elevator started.  He looks around, and the doors open. elevator.  The doors close.
Snake's voice comes through the radio.
I'm inside the World Trade Center on the 50th floor.  Jus Leningrad, Hauk.
Is the glider intact?
Snake stands with his walkie-talkie in the middle of the covered building.
Yeah, but taking off is for shit.  I'll work it out.
You'll have to use the east stairwell.  It'll take you a get to ground level. Snake checks his life clock.  19:22:44. 43. 42.
Call me when you get outside. Snake puts his walkie-talkie away as someone runs past. notice.  He walks on. FADE OUT.
Snake walks along with his tracer.  He goes through alley He draws his gun as he walks by a group of people.  He's to fight.
The plane is still burning.  Smoke is coming from everywh is severed in the middle.  The crash is very impressive. and notices a few people go by.  He pulls out his walkie-
I'm at the plane.  Nobody else made it, Hauk. Something beeps.  His tracer.
Wait a minute. He looks at his tracer.  A small red dot lights up in the corner.
I've got his pulse.  Right up ahead, moving northwest. He puts away his walkie-talkie and checks his life clock. 17.  16.
Images.  Snake holding the tracer.  He gets closer and co building, formerly a theater.  He walks in.
The pulse keeps getting stronger.  Snake walks in.  He ho the ready.  There's a truly horrible musical going on.

This is hell!  This is hate!  (etc.) Snake looks around.  No sign of the president, but there enjoying the show.  Time to move on.  He enters against h judgment, but he's just passing through, so that's OK.
Snake keeps moving, but there's a noise.  He turns around gun.  Cabbie holds up his hands.
Hey!  You're Snake Plissken, ain't you?
What do you want?
Nothin'. Snake lowers his gun.
I thought you were dead! Snake moves on.
Hey!  You don't want to walk around down there, Snake!
The signal from the tracer keeps getting closer and close past a gang beating up and stripping a semi-conscious gir take much notice.  He keeps going.  He sees a BUM sitting
Hi, Chief.  Nice night.  Nice boots.  Niiiiice boots.  He A guy tries to sneak up behind Snake.  Snake knocks him o his gun at the bum.
Easy now, chief.  I'm walking.  I'm walking. The bum walks away.  Snake keeps going.  A man beats up a sink.  The beatee is wearing the President's life tracer. the beater and knocks him out.
Mr. President . . . The man wearing the life tracer looks up and smiles.  He'
I'm the President?  Sure, I'm the President.  If I knew w thing -- (indicates the tracer) I'd be the President.
Where did you get it?
I woke up, and there it was, just like a miracle . . . Snake slams the tracer against the sink.
The President's life signs all fail.
Oh my god . . .
It . . . It may be just an impact on the mechanism itself
Snake pulls up his walkie-talkie.
Hauk?!
I'm right here, Plissken.
I don't know who you assholes are looking at, but it's NO President.
Snake holds the walkie-talkie up to the drunk.
(to the tune of Joy to the World) Hail to the chief . . . La la la la la la . . .
All right, get your machine ready.  I'm coming out.
18 hours, Plissken.
Listen to me, Hauk.  The President is DEAD, you got that? had him for dinner!
Plissken, if you get back in that glider I'll shoot you d out, I'll burn you off the wall.  You understand that, Pl
Snake stares at his walkie-talkie.
A little human compassion . . .

text: You a cop? Snake levels his gun at her.
No . . .

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: You've got a gun.  You got a smoke? Snake tosses her his cigarettes.  She lights one.
Keep your hand over it.

text: It's all right if we're quiet.  They won't hear us. (reacting to the cigarette) Hey, this is a real one.  You just get in?
What's going on out there?

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: Crazies.  It's the end of the month.  They're out of food
Do you live here?

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: Skulls?  You kidding?  I'm with the Turks now.  I just go street after dark and now I'm stuck here all night.
A plane crashed seven hours ago.  Did you see it?

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: No.
Shit.

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: You're a cop.
I'm an asshole.

text: Hey, wait a minute.  I know who you are.  Yeah!  But I he dead.
I am.

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: Wow, Snake Plissken.  All right!  What you doing in here Snake?
Looking for somebody.

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: Who?
The President.

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: Come on!  He really here?
Somewhere.

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: When you find him, are you gonna take him out?
Mm-hm.

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: Take me out with you, Snake.
Why?

head_text.subj: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

text: I can think of lots of reasons why . . . She makes a move to kiss him, but there's a noise.  They she gets sucked through the floor.  Snake tries to save h too late.  He gets the hell out of there.

Snake runs through the building, breaks a window, and cli escape to get to a new floor.  He breaks a window to get a cabinet in front of the window.  He shoots through the causing some crazy to scream.  He busts down a door, shoo a wall, busts through that, climbs out a window, and clim telephone pole.  He then climbs up a wall.  On the way he walkie-talkie.  He runs down an alley, and as he does, Ca

Snake notices a tape player which is playing the theme fr Bandstand."

Bad neighborhood, Snake!  You don't want to be walking fr to 42nd street at night!  I've been driving a cab here fo I'm telling you, you don't walk around here at night!  Ye They'll kill you and strip you in ten seconds flat.  Usua down around here myself, but I wanted to catch that show. Cabbie lights a rag stuffed down the neck of a bottle whi gasoline.
This stuff is like gold around here, you know.
Cabbie throws the bottle into the alley, where it explode
Hey, Snake, when'd you get in?  I didn't even know they c (laughs) Ohhh, Snake Plissken in my cab.  Wait'll I tell Eddie!  H Snake.
Cabbie makes a sharp turn.
Hey, what were you doing back there, Snake?
Looking for somebody.
Well, why didn't you ask me?  Hell, I know everybody in t sir.  I've been driving this cab for thirty years, this v Snake points his gun at Cabbie.
I'm GONNA ask you.  Now where's the President?
The Duke's got him!  Everyone knows the Duke's got him! to put a gun to my head.  I'll tell you!
Who's the Duke?
The DUKE!  The Duke of New York!  A-Number-1!  The big ma
I want to meet this Duke.
You can't meet the Duke, are you crazy?  Nobody wants to You meet him once and then you're dead! Snake points the gun more insistently.  Tough.
Cabbie parks the cab and he and Snake walk up to Brain's
I hate to leave her on the street.  Usually I don't leave all.  But you're a special case, Snake. He and Snake walk up to the door.  Cabbie knocks on the d shoe.
It's OK, Snake.  It's a better neighborhood.  You can rel Relax?  Snake checks his life clock.  17:40:46. 45. 44.
Thanks.
Boy, they got a great place here.  Like a fortress!
They? From the inside, someone answers.
Who is it?
It's me!
Who's me?
Cabbie!
What do you want?
Somebody wants to see Brain, it's important --
No way, Cabbie --
No, it's Snake!  Snake Plissken! Maggie opens the door.  She stands there and surveys the
YOU'RE Plissken?
He wants to see Brain.
Why?
I want to meet the Duke. Snake and Maggie exchange a glance.  She leads them in.
Hey, what do you think of this place, Snake?  It used to library.  Oh, that Brain, he's the greatest!  Mr. Fabulou him.
(gesturing at Maggie) Who's that?

That's Maggie.  Brain's squeeze.  The Duke gave him to Br keep him happy . . . see what I mean? Snake can tell that Maggie's more than just Brain's squee bodyguard, too.  She looks like she'd be willing to kill Brain.
Heard you were dead.
Brain?  Brain!  I brought somebody to see you! Snake looks at Brain.  He knows this guy.
Harold Helman. Brain puts down his book and stands up.
Snake?
"Harold"?
Where you been, Harold?  It's been a long time.
You never told me you knew Snake Plissken, Brain.
Isn't that great?  Hey, Brain, I could use some gas if yo some . . . No one pays attention.  Snake advances on Brain.  Brain s
I'm glad you remember me.  Yeah.  A man should remember h Kansas City, four years ago.  You ran out on me.  You lef there.
You were late.
We were buddies, Harold.  You, me, and Fresno Bob.  You k did to Bob? His face changes.  He suddenly kicks Brain's chair into t points his gun. Maggie draws a knife and starts advancing on Snake.
You want to see him sprayed all over that map, baby? (to Brain) Where's the President?!
Swear to god, Snake, I don't know --
Don't fuck with me!
Why do you want to know?
I want him.
Working for the man now, huh?
Then I'll just beat it out of your squeeze --
Mm-hm.  Maggie doesn't know EXACTLY where he is and unles EXACTLY PRECISELY where he is you'll never find him. Snake takes his gun away.  He contemplates Brain.
Listen, I'll take you out of here.  Yeah.  Jet glider jus blocks down the street.  And all you gotta do is get me t Everyone realizes the importance of this.
No kidding?  On the level?  Will you take me, too?
We've got to deal somewhere else.
No glider.
We've got the President.  And the Duke's taking everybody
Never happen.  See, I know something you and the Duke don only got so long before Mr. President don't mean a whole
You're lying.
Maybe he's not . . .
I know him!  Look at his face, he's lying!
Right, Harold.  I'm lying.  So I might as well have some looking by myself. He cocks his gun and points it at Brain again.
Brain --
Talk to him, baby --
Brain, he'll kill us both if you don't tell him --
(panicking) Brain, you've got to tell him!
(panicking) Brain, you've got to tell him --
(panicked) Tell him, tell him, tell him --
Snake lowers the gun.
You always were smart, Harold.
Just one thing right now.  Don't call me "Harold."
